Class Complex

  • java.lang.Object
    • Complex

  • public class Complex
extends java.lang.Object
    Complex is a class which implements complex numbers in Java. It includes basic operations that can be performed on complex numbers such as, addition, subtraction, multiplication, conjugate, modulus and squaring. The data type for Complex Numbers.

    The features of this library include:
    • Arithmetic Operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
    • Complex Specific Operations - Conjugate, Inverse, Absolute/Magnitude, Argument/Phase
    • Trigonometric Operations - sin, cos, tan, cot, sec, cosec
    • Mathematical Functions - exp
    • Complex Parsing of type x+yi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int RCIS
      Used in format(int) to format the complex number as R.cis(theta), where theta is arg(z)
      static int XY
      Used in format(int) to format the complex number as x+yi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Complex()
      Constructs a new Complex object with both real and imaginary parts 0 (z = 0 + 0i).
      Complex(double real, double imaginary)
      Constructs a new Complex object.

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(int format_id)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Formats the Complex number as x+yi or r.cis(theta)
        Parameters:
        format_id - the format ID Complex.XY or Complex.RCIS.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the complex number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format_id does not match.
